result.execSummary:
The defendant ShQuale M Howard was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting/Failing to Stop, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(2t).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $67 VW surcharge paid in full from bond.

2:55 PM Defendant ShQuale M Howard in court with Attorney Ronald Gabriel Benavides on behalf of  Attorney Guy Cardamone.  ADA Timothy Robert Verhoff in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Ludwig Hearing Held, State places last best offer on the record. Defendant accepts offer will enter plea today.

Back on the record at 3:14 PM, all appearances remain the same. 

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 1 as amended.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

AMENDMENTS: Count 1 amended to 346.04(2t)

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #1 
The Court sentences Defendant to:
-Serve 60 days in Dane County Jail, with Huber and Jail Diversion; to commence on November 27, 2022 at 7:00 am 

-Days credit for time served: zero days credit  
-Days credit to jail: zero days credit

Ct #1
